Note: Formerly listed under 6526, which is of similar content.
Subjects: good deeds; almsgiving; wealth, wise use of; advice, moral
_description: On the need to use one’s good wisely — eight lines with alternating rhyme, one rhyme being ‘good’ in various meanings

CamTCC1450.Transcription:
Who hath good can gooda wyse man he ys holdeho hath no good can
                    no gooda wyse man hyt me toldehyt ys not good for no gooda man to
                    be to boldeþer ys no good but goddys goodbut hyt wull flet &
                    fold
CamTCC1450.Editions:
Hammerle,  Karl. 
             “Verstreute me und frühne Lyrik.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         166 (1935): 195-204: 198-9.
